metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15680 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
If a valid external protocol handler was referenced in an image tag, the resulting broken image size could be distinguished from a broken image size of a non-existent protocol handler. This allowed an attacker to successfully probe whether an external protocol handler was registered. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 82.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15680` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
